question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $85,000 and no existing debts?
true_answer: With an annual income of $85,000, you can afford a home loan of approximately $408,000, assuming a 28% front-end DTI ratio.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $85,000 and no existing debts?
Plan: 1) Calculate affordable loan amount using income and standard DTI. 2) Retrieve down payment information. 3) Review with supervisor. 4) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on standard DTI ratios for home loans.
Standard front-end DTI ratio is usually 28% of gross income.
Calculating maximum loan amount using income and a 28% front-end DTI.
Calculated maximum loan amount is approximately $408,000.
Does this include the down payment requirement?
Retrieving knowledge on down payment requirements.
Down payment typically ranges from 3% to 20% of the home price.
The loan amount calculated does not include the down payment.
Review complete, all calculations are accurate.
With an annual income of $85,000, you can afford a home loan of approximately $408,000, assuming a 28% front-end DTI ratio. This does not include the down payment, which ranges from 3% to 20%.
Task successfully completed and user informed.
